comment._content: Hey Carol, I am but a - enough of the song writing.  How would you describe the dog accompanying the other gent?  Nice photo and again look at the quality of the image given the age of the photo?  Wonderful stuff!

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Isn't it lovely? The water is quite incredible. Thought at first the dog was a spaniel, but now I'm veering towards a collie-type. What do you think?

comment.author: 66340104@N05
comment._content: Was this not removed around the time of the construction of the Hydroelectric dam?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66340104@N05] When was that then?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 66340104@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Some time in the 1950's. The construction of the new dam included a new salmon run, a bit like the one on the right of the weir shown here, except a lot larger/longer. The dam used to be open to the public before things got really heated at the end of the sixties and I remember going in through the gates and parking near it on the seaward side. Apparently(can't remember much else as I was only 3 or 4 yrs old) there was a room that allowed folk to see the salmon swimming up the run as they headed upstream during breeding season.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66340104@N05] A salmon viewing room? Pretty amazing!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
